content.definition: A localized dilation of the renal artery to 1.5 times its normal diameter, or any discrete saccular dilation. Renal artery aneurysms are the second most common visceral aneurysm after splenic aneurysm and have special considerations regarding rupture risk in pregnancy.

pregnancy.mortality: Up to 80% maternal/fetal mortality with rupture

diagnosis.classic_finding: Ring calcification on plain film or CT (signet ring sign)

surveillance: Annual imaging for small asymptomatic aneurysms

learning_objectives: Know indications for renal artery aneurysm repair
Understand special considerations in women of childbearing age
clinical_pearls: Second most common visceral aneurysm (after splenic)
FMD is most common cause (not atherosclerosis)
PREGNANCY = markedly increased rupture risk = repair before
Signet ring calcification on plain film is classic
Size threshold for repair: 2 cm (lower for childbearing women)
